text: Colby Cave (December 26, 1994 – April 11, 2020) was a Canadian professional ice hockey centre. He played for the Boston Bruins and Edmonton Oilers of the National Hockey League (NHL). His career lasted from 2015 until his death in 2020. He was born in North Battleford, Saskatchewan, Canada. Cave had a brain bleed caused by a cyst on April 6–7, 2020. He had emergency surgery on April 7 in Toronto. He died while under a medically induced coma in the early hours of April 11, aged 25. ==References== Category:1994 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from cerebral hemorrhage Category:Boston Bruins players Category:Edmonton Oilers players Category:Ice hockey people from Saskatchewan Category:Ice hockey centres
title: Colby Cave
